text: Saturnino "Nino" Manfredi (; 22 March 1921 - 4 June 2004) was an Italian actor. He was born in Lazio, Italy. He was also a movie and stage director, screenwriter, playwright, comedian, singer, author, radio and television presenter. During his career he won many awards, including six David di Donatello awards, six Nastro d'Argento awards and the Prix de la premi√®re oeuvre (Best First Work Award) at the 1971 Cannes Film Festival for Between Miracles. He is thought to be the greatest Italian actor of all time.
